report_title: Hair Loss Treatment Manufacturing Industry Report
executive_summary: The proliferation of low-cost generic oral hair loss treatments in recent years has made such treatments more accessible. However, the prevalence of generic products has intensified competitive price pressures, adversely affecting industry revenue. Furthermore, demand for hair loss treatments declined in 2020 because of COVID-19. Also, consumer confidence has dropped for most of the period and soaring inflation has caused interest rates to skyrocket. So, industry-wide revenue has been decreasing at a CAGR of 2.0% over the past five years, including an estimated 3.3% increase in the current year, and is expected to total $3.8 billion in 2023. In the same year, profit is projected to plateau to 9.6%.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The US Food and Drug Administration (FDA) has approved only a few drugs for hair loss treatments
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The US Food and Drug Administration (FDA) has approved two products for hair loss: Propecia (finasteride) and Rogaine (minoxidil), sustaining demand despite price competition. Companies with products approved by the FDA can typically garner higher profit since some consumers are wary of using substitute products that the FDA does not regulate. Women's access to hair loss treatments like finasteride and minoxidil is restricted, impacting industry revenue. However, other options, like hormonal solutions, are available.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Low-cost generic oral hair loss treatments have made products more accessible
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The patent cliff has enabled more patent drug makers to enter the market and produce generic substitutes.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Major pharmaceutical companies face stiff competition
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Major pharmaceutical companies like Merck are facing acceleration towards generic and lower-cost store-brand substitutes in the market. Merck's Propecia, for example, has seen many competitors arising from generic and store-brand production. Store-brand versions like Walmart's "Equate" brand, enable more consumers to purchase hair loss treatments, thereby further constraining industry growth.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Manufacturers Face Stiff Competition From International Brands
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Domestic manufacturers cannot compete with lower wages and less stringent labor laws in other countries. According to the latest data available from the ISHRS, Asia had the most hair restorative procedures performed, demonstrating robust demand for hair loss treatments. Downstream retailers have increasingly sourced hair loss treatments from abroad to reduce purchase costs and gain profit.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Patent Expirations Will Represent The Major Threat To The Industry
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The Hair Loss Treatment Manufacturing industry will face moderate growth over the next five years. However, some brand-name products will lose patent exclusivity, cutting into revenue growth for branded product manufacturers. The competition will hike as many branded pharmaceuticals lose their patents and more new companies produce low-priced generic hair loss treatment alternatives.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: R E S E A R C H  A N D  D E V E L O P M E N T  W I L L  L I K E LY  R E M A I N  C R I T I C A L T O  M A I N T A I N I N G  A  M A R K E T  P R E S E N C E
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Manufacturers will continue investing in research and development to formulate new and innovative hair loss treatments to gain market share. New treatments are likely to focus on user convenience and better results – with at-home treatments like low-level lasers will undergo major improvements, making them easier to use and providing better results. Drugs already approved by the FDA, like Latisse, a drug for eyelash growth, may have applications for hair follicle growth.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: E N V I R O N M E N T  P R E S E R V A T I O N  W I L L  L I K E LY  T A K E  P R E C E D E N C E I N  T H E  M A N U F A C T U R E  O F  H A I R  L O S S  T R E A T M E N T S
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Concerns about carbon footprints will encourage manufacturers to find new eco-friendly resources, develop new products and introduce new packaging. The production of organic and all-natural hair loss treatments is set to hike because of growing consumer awareness of the potential benefits of using sustainable hair care solutions.

products_and_services.product_description: Oral and Topical Hair Loss Treatments Account for the Majority of Revenue
Oral and topical treatments remain the pillar of the hair loss treatment industry, with key products including Propecia (finasteride), Rogaine (minoxidil), biotin, Avodart and saw palmetto.

Hair loss shampoos are specialized formulations used in the early or later stages of hair loss to slow down the process and foster hair growth, often incorporating natural or prescription ingredients.

The FDA Approves the Use of Laser Treatments for Hair Loss. Low-level lasers consist of devices with diodes that emit red light. Despite its controversial stance, studies have found low-level laser therapy benefits hair growth, leading to the FDA's approval of the HairMax LaserComb.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: The Hair Loss Treatment Industry Greatly Serves Individuals Under 29 Years
demand_determinants.determinant_description: This segment primarily comprises Millennials, Generation Z and Gen Alpha. Male Pattern Baldness (MPB) often begins in this age group, with a considerable portion of men developing this condition before adulthood. Individuals in this market segment typically demand products that help mitigate hair loss during the early stages, like hair loss shampoos and nonprescription treatments.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Individuals Aged 30 to 49 Represent the Largest Market Sector for the Hair-Loss Industry
demand_determinants.determinant_description: This segment primarily consists of Millennials and a few individuals from Generation X.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Older Generations' (Individuals Aged 50 and Older) Hair Loss Triggers Spending on Treatments
demand_determinants.determinant_description: This segment primarily comprises Generation X, Baby Boomers and a few individuals from The Silent Generation. Most men in this age group experience thinning hair, possibly because of genetic factors or medication side effects like beta-blockers, hormones and antidepressants can induce hair loss in this age group. High disposable income in older age groups fuels spending on hair loss treatments.

international_trade_points.trade_title: Importers Benefit From a Rising US Dollar
international_trade_points.trade_description: An appreciating US dollar has made imported products more affordable domestically.

Demand for both high-end and affordable products has been increasingly satisfied by imports. Less stringent environmental regulations and lower labor costs in foreign nations, such as China, enable producers in these countries to manufacture and market products at reduced prices.

international_trade_points.trade_title: The United States Exports to a Handful of Foreign Markets
international_trade_points.trade_description: The value of hair loss treatment exports has increased; however, the US dollar's appreciation has caused US goods to be more expensive in foreign markets. Overseas manufacturers depend on the perceived high quality of US-made goods to entice foreign buyers, notably Canada, Mexico and China. Rising consumer spending in foreign countries has supported demand for US exports.

international_trade_points.trade_title: Foreign Lower-Cost Production is Taking the Lead
international_trade_points.trade_description: Exports are at risk as affordable foreign producers attract global demand. The ability to produce goods abroad allows for more fierce domestic product competition.

business_locations.location_description: The West region's proximity to foreign markets makes it an attractive hub for international trade. The region also provides access to talented labor, making it attractive for drug manufacturers. California has the most industry establishments, with almost one-quarter of domestic hair loss treatment manufacturers.

This region is close to upstream chemical producers and contains significant shipping ports, which have become increasingly crucial to shipping within the United States and for export destinations. New Jersey is the largest state by the number of establishments because of a relatively low cost of living, strong research from state colleges and supportive state government. Pfizer, Merck & Co. and GlaxoSmithKline are all located in the Mid-Atlantic region.

This region has significant consumer destinations like Atlanta and Miami, with high population densities. Florida has several shipping ports connecting the United States to export destinations and imported low-price industry suppliers.

regulations_points.regulation_description: Manufacturers of developed products for hair loss treatment have to undergo stringent clinical trials.
US Patent Laws protect intellectual property rights, punishing infringement with fines.
Producers are subject to labor regulations covering occupational health and safety, wage, overtime and other employment issues.
Health and safety guidelines were established in 2020 amid the COVID-19 pandemic advising temporary social distancing and sanitation measures.

factors_decreased_barrier: Market Competition Intensifies with the Entry of Generic Manufacturers

basis_points.basis_title: Product diversity is the driving factor of competition
basis_points.basis_description: To appeal to all consumer segments, they must create and market various products, including topicals, ingestible and laser treatments.
Larger companies, with ample capital, R&D investments and market reach, can introduce new products efficiently.
Smaller companies may struggle to quickly build customer trust, impacting competitiveness.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Diverse treatment methods lead to a fragmented industry
concentration_points.concentration_description: Numerous companies develop diverse hair loss treatments, mirroring oral or topical applications, laser treatments and hair-restoration techniques. No single company dominates the market because of the broad range of products and their respective administration methods.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Market Competition Intensifies with the Entry of Generic Manufacturers
concentration_points.concentration_description: Patent exclusivity on certain name-brand products has ended, launching an influx of generic drug manufacturers into the market. This dramatic shift has significantly affected the revenue growth of branded item manufacturers. The industry will remain highly fragmented as more generic drug manufacturers enter the market.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Purchase costs comprise a significant portion of the industry's total revenue, even with a noted drop over periods attributed to reduced costs of certain crucial inputs like plastic and resin.
Companies have invested in research and development and promotion activities, increasing their labor demand and pushing up wage costs.
Manufacturers incur costs related to administrative fees, insurance, warehousing, transportation and R&D.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The major markets for this industry are highly concentrated, which implies that the market has a focus on key customer segments.

volatility_points.volatility_description: When more individuals have health insurance, they can visit healthcare providers and access prescription hair loss treatments.
Industry revenue has fluctuated due to brand-name products losing patent exclusivity and global events like COVID-19 pandemic.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Oral and topical treatments are majority revenue
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Oral and topical treatments remain the pillar of the hair loss treatment industry, with key products like Propecia, Rogaine, biotin, etc.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Hair loss shampoos on the rise
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Hair loss shampoos are specialized formulations used to slow hair loss and foster growth, often complemented by other treatments.
The FDA has approved low-level laser devices like HairMax LaserComb for hair loss treatment.
